net.sourceforge.waters.model.module

Interface ModuleProxy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<NamedProxy>, ComparableProxy<NamedProxy>, DocumentProxy, NamedProxy, Proxy
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ModuleElement

    public interface ModuleProxy
extends DocumentProxy

    The top-level information container in Waters.

    A module contains a list of automata and associated events. Modules are stored in XML files with the extension .wmod, which uses the XML schema called waters-module.dtd.

    In the simplest case, a module contains a list of event declarations (EventDeclProxy) and a list of components, i.e. automata (SimpleComponentProxy). For example, a simple version of Small Factory may consist of the following parts.

     MODULE small_factory_simple;
 EVENTS
   controllable start1;
   controllable start2;
   uncontrollable finish1;
   uncontrollable finish2;
   uncontrollable break1;
   uncontrollable break2;
   controllable repair1;
   controllable repair2;
 COMPONENTS
   plant mach1;
   plant mach2;
   spec buffer;

    More advanced modules can also have parameters and aliases. These features make it possible to describe complex parameterised structures. Similar automata can be reused by replacing their events in various ways.

    A more advanced version of the small factory example above would use only one automaton for the two almost identical machines mach1 and mach2. This is achieved by creating a machine module containing the one machine automaton. The advanced small factory module uses event arrays and instantiates the machine module twice using a loop.

     MODULE machine;
 PARAMETERS
   controllable start;
   uncontrollable finish;
 EVENTS
   uncontrollable break;
   controllable repair;
 COMPONENTS
   plant mach;

 MODULE small_factory_advanced;
 EVENTS
   controllable start[1..2];
   uncontrollable finish[1..2];
 COMPONENTS
   FOR i IN 1..2
     instance machine[i] = machine(
       start = start[i];
       finish = finish[i];
     );
   ENDFOR
   spec buffer;

    Further instantiation and abstraction is possible using EFA variables (VariableComponentProxy) or aliases (AliasProxy).

    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Method Detail

      • getConstantAliasList

        List<ConstantAliasProxy> getConstantAliasList()
        Gets the constant definition list of this module.
        Returns:
        The constant definition list.

      • getEventDeclList

        List<EventDeclProxy> getEventDeclList()
        Gets the event declaration list of this module.
        Returns:
        The list of event declarations.

      • getEventAliasList

        List<Proxy> getEventAliasList()
        Gets the event alias list of this module.
        Returns:
        The list event aliases. Each element is of type AliasProxy or ForeachProxy.

      • getComponentList

        List<Proxy> getComponentList()
        Gets the component list of this module. This list does not only contain the automata (SimpleComponentProxy) of the module, but also all EFA variables (VariableComponentProxy) and module instances (InstanceProxy). All these items can be nested in foreach blocks (ForeachProxy).
        Returns:
        The component list. Each element is of type ComponentProxy or ForeachProxy.
